headline: Why AI has a familiar tune to the Dot-Com Bubble
summary: As more Big Tech names increase spending on artificial intelligence and AI infrastructure, should Wall Street be cautious of a market bubble forming akin to the Dot-Com crash? Epistrophy Capital Research chief market strategist Cory Johnson sits down with Market Domination host Josh Lipton for a conversation about which aspects of the AI Boom do carry some similarities with the Dot-Com Bubble. Johnson is also the host of The Drill Down podcast. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Oracle Provides Update on TSX-V Review of Fluorspar, Coal and Silver NSR Agreements

(TSXV: ORCL) (OTCQB: ORLCF) ("Oracle" or the "Company") advises that, pursuant to TSX Venture Exchange ("TSX-V") policies, the Company is providing an update on the status of the TSX-V's review of: (i) the net smelter return ("NSR") royalty agreement with CleanTech Vanadium Mining Corp. headline: Analysts Issue a Key Warning on Oracle Stock: Sell Now
summary: Oracle stock has nearly doubled this year on cloud and AI optimism, but with a stretched valuation above 57x forward earnings, Rothschild has issued a rare “Sell” rating and a $175 target—warning that market hype may have outpaced real growth prospects.

headline: Comcast names insider Michael Cavanagh as co-CEO ahead of cable spinoff
summary: Cavanagh will take up the new role in January and also join the company's board, serving alongside Brian Roberts, who will continue as chairman and co-CEO.  Comcast plans to spin off its NBCUniversal cable channels, including USA Network and CNBC, into a new company called Versant later this year amid shifting market dynamics and growing interest in streaming platforms.  "He is the ideal person to help lead Comcast as we manage the pivot we are making to drive growth across the company," Roberts said in a statement.

raw.headline: Comcast names insider Michael Cavanagh as co-CEO ahead of cable spinoff
raw.summary: Cavanagh will take up the new role in January and also join the company's board, serving alongside Brian Roberts, who will continue as chairman and co-CEO.  Comcast plans to spin off its NBCUniversal cable channels, including USA Network and CNBC, into a new company called Versant later this year amid shifting market dynamics and growing interest in streaming platforms.  "He is the ideal person to help lead Comcast as we manage the pivot we are making to drive growth across the company," Roberts said in a statement.

headline: Is the AI hype over? Alibaba says no.
summary: Calls of the Day: Despite growing talk of an AI bubble - and stocks such as Oracle (ORCL) tumbling - analysts at Morningstar and Morgan Stanley released new reports arguing that there's still a lot of room to grow for China's e-commerce giant Alibaba (BABA, 9988.HK) - especially in its global cloud expansion. The calls further fueled the rise of Alibaba's listing in New York and Hong Kong on Monday, extending a rally that has seen the Chinese giant gain around 50% in the past month. For more live coverage of markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

The calls further fueled the rise of Alibaba's listing in New York and Hong Kong on Monday, extending a rally that has seen the Chinese giant gain around 50% in the past month. For more live coverage of markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

headline: Former Energy Secretary Rick Perry's Fermi upsizes US IPO, aims to raise $715 million
summary: Co-founded by former U.S. Energy Secretary Rick Perry, the company is aiming to sell 32.5 million shares priced between $18 and $22 apiece, compared with its previous target of 25 million shares.  Fermi's upsized offering also indicates pent-up investor appetite for companies at the heart of the AI race, as the vast majority of leaders in the space continue to stay private.  Nvidia-backed AI cloud provider CoreWeave's shares have more than tripled their IPO price since their debut in March.

Fermi's upsized offering also indicates pent-up investor appetite for companies at the heart of the AI race, as the vast majority of leaders in the space continue to stay private.  Nvidia-backed AI cloud provider CoreWeave's shares have more than tripled their IPO price since their debut in March.

headline: Tech-Bubble Fears Rise in New Investor Poll
summary: Concerns that U.S. technology stocks are in a bubble crept higher in Deutsche Bank’s quarterly survey of institutional investors.  On a scale from 1 to 10, from “no bubble” to “extreme bubble”, respondents gave tech stocks a 7.4, the bank said in its report Monday.  Deutsche's survey was based on 280 responses from around the world, with respondents polled last week on a range of topics.

raw.headline: Tech-Bubble Fears Rise in New Investor Poll
raw.summary: Concerns that U.S. technology stocks are in a bubble crept higher in Deutsche Bank’s quarterly survey of institutional investors.  On a scale from 1 to 10, from “no bubble” to “extreme bubble”, respondents gave tech stocks a 7.4, the bank said in its report Monday.  Deutsche's survey was based on 280 responses from around the world, with respondents polled last week on a range of topics.

headline: Debt Is Fueling the Next Wave of the AI Boom
summary: Early on, wealthy tech companies were opening their wallets to out-joust each other for leadership in artificial intelligence.  There was no debt-fueled splurge on computing and networking infrastructure like the one that inflated the bubble 2½ decades ago.  While big tech companies are still at AI’s forefront and are in solid financial shape, a crop of more highly leveraged companies is ushering in an era that could change the complexion of the boom.

raw.headline: Debt Is Fueling the Next Wave of the AI Boom

headline: Oracle Achieves Swift Compatible Application for Payments 2025
summary: Oracle Financial Services today announced that Oracle Banking Payments has been validated as a Swift Compatible Application. With this achievement, financial institutions can feel confident in leveraging Oracle's solutions to help meet Swift standards for payment security, interoperability, and regulatory compliance, while benefitting from modern, AI-enabled payment messaging processing.

headline: Government Shutdown Looms: What it Means, How Rare It Is, and Why Investors Shouldn't Worry
summary: While the political rhetoric makes a government shutdown seem probable, investors need not panic. Historically, these shutdowns have been short-lived and have generally had a minimal, if not positive impact on stocks.

raw.headline: Government Shutdown Looms: What it Means, How Rare It Is, and Why Investors Shouldn't Worry
